item.title: Steve Cropper, guitarist and member of Stax Records' Booker T and the M.G.'s, dies
item.description: Steve Cropper, who co-wrote classics including "(Sittin' on) the Dock of the Bay" and "In the Midnight Hour" during his years playing guitar at the legendary Stax Records in Memphis, has died. He was 84.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: How Minnesota became a hub for Somali immigrants in the U.S.
item.description: Minnesota boasts the largest population of Somalis in the U.S. — a community that's recently faced attacks from President Trump. Here's a brief history of how they came to settle there.

item.title: Filmmaker Jafar Panahi is sentenced again in Iran as Hollywood's awards season starts
item.description: Panahi's latest film, It Was Just an Accident, won three Gotham Awards on Monday. The filmmaker has been imprisoned in Iran before — but continues to make movies.

item.title: Trump administration rolls back fuel economy standards
item.description: At the White House this afternoon, President Trump said he was terminating "ridiculously burdensome" fuel economy rules. It's part of a series of changes relaxing or eliminating rules promoting cleaner cars.

item.title: Pentagon watchdog finds Hegseth risked the safety of U.S. forces with use of Signal

item.title: Trump uses 'Third World' in a social media post. What's up with that term?
item.description: "I will permanently pause migration from all Third World Countries to allow the U.S. system to fully recover," he wrote on Truth Social. That label raises the issue of how to classify certain nations.

item.title: Did the Trump administration commit a war crime in its attack on a Venezuelan boat?
